_description: Use this template to provide custom parameters for nodal analysis calculations
_wellhead_pressure_bar_description: Wellhead pressure in bar (typical range: 10-50 bar)
_flow_rate_m3_h_description: Production flow rate in cubic meters per hour
_fluid_density_kg_m3_description: Fluid density in kg/m³ (water≈1000, brine≈1050-1200, oil≈800-900)
_fluid_viscosity_cP_description: Fluid viscosity in centiPoise (water≈1.0, light oil≈5-10, heavy oil≈100+)
_depth_m_description: True vertical depth or measured depth in meters (typically pump intake or mid-perforation depth)
_usage_instructions: To use this file, save it and run:
1. Extract all available parameters from the PDF
2. Override with values from this JSON file
4. Include results in the summary and report

_parameter_guidelines.wellhead_pressure_bar: Measure at wellhead or from separator. Account for seasonal variations.
_parameter_guidelines.flow_rate_m3_h: Use stabilized rate, not initial transient. Convert from bbl/d if needed (1 m³/h ≈ 6.29 bbl/d).
_parameter_guidelines.tubing_inner_diameter_in: Use actual ID, not nominal. Check wear/corrosion for old wells.
_parameter_guidelines.fluid_density_kg_m3: Consider temperature effects. Use PVT lab data if available.
_parameter_guidelines.fluid_viscosity_cP: Temperature-dependent. Use downhole conditions, not surface.
_parameter_guidelines.reservoir_temperature_c: Get from logging data or thermal models. Increases with depth (~3°C/100m).
_parameter_guidelines.depth_m: Use pump setting depth or mid-perforation for most accurate results.
